SARFAESI | Confirmed Sale Can't Be Set Aside For Mere Irregularities Except Fraud, Collusion, Inadequate... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
SARFAESI | Confirmed Sale Can't Be Set Aside For Mere Irregularities Except Fraud, Collusion, Inadequate...

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Not specified

The Supreme Court recently clarified the grounds under which a sale of property under the SARFAESI Act can be challenged after confirmation, emphasizing that only fundamental errors like fraud or collusion are valid reasons for setting aside a sale.

  • The Court held that procedural irregularities alone cannot invalidate a confirmed sale.
  • Only substantial procedural errors such as fraud, collusion, or inadequate pricing warrant intervention.
  • Legal challenges should ideally be raised before the confirmation of the sale.
  • The judgment referenced V.S. Palanivel v. P. Sriram, reinforcing that courts should avoid setting aside auctions unless serious flaws are identified.
  • The case involved a minor procedural point regarding the gap between sale and auction notices, which was insufficient for a successful challenge.
"Any sale by auction or other public procurement methods once already confirmed or concluded ought not to be set-aside or interfered with lightly except on grounds that go to the core of such sale process, such as either being collusive, fraudulent or vitiated by inadequate pricing or underbidding."

In conclusion, the Supreme Court reinforced the stability of confirmed sales under the SARFAESI Act, allowing challenges only in cases of significant procedural shortcomings. This ruling aims to maintain confidence in auction processes and avoid unnecessary disruptions.

Honda Launched New Amaze & Announced Rs 1 Lakh Discount! - MotorOctane
summary:
Honda Launched New Amaze & Announced Rs 1 Lakh Discount!

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: MotorOctane

Honda has launched the new Amaze in India, priced between Rs 9.04 lakh and Rs 12.98 lakh, while still offering discounts on the old model to boost sales.

  • The new Amaze is priced between Rs 9.04 lakh and Rs 12.98 lakh (on-road, Mumbai).
  • Honda offers discounts of up to Rs 1.12 lakh on the previous-generation Amaze, particularly for the top-spec VX variant.
  • Discounts for other variants range from Rs 62,000 to Rs 72,000.
  • The new model features ADAS technology, redesigned exterior, and updated interior with modern tech amenities.
  • Buyers are encouraged to check discounts at their local Honda dealerships as they may vary.
“The new compact sedan is one of the most feature-loaded cars having the first in segment ADAS suite.”

The introduction of the new Honda Amaze, coupled with attractive discounts on the previous generation, aims to cater to diverse customer needs in the competitive car market.

India’s mutual fund investors have got their 1st taste of a big market shake-up. It’s made them cautious - ThePrint
summary:
India’s mutual fund investors have got their 1st taste of a big market shake-up. It’s made them cautious.

Publication Date: December 12, 2024 Source: ThePrint

India's mutual fund investors are becoming increasingly cautious in response to recent stock market volatility, with the market experiencing a notable correction over the past months that has affected their systematic investment plans (SIPs).

  • New investors are feeling the impact of a 10% market drop within two months.
  • Net SIP account additions have declined for four consecutive months, marking a significant trend.
  • The stoppage ratio of SIP accounts, or closures versus openings, has surged to 79.1%—the highest since April 2022.
  • Foreign institutional investors have withdrawn Rs 1.6 lakh crore from Indian markets over October and November.
  • Demat accounts surged from 4.09 crore in April 2020 to 17.9 crore in October 2024, indicating a rise in new investors.
“The 10 percent correction from the September peak—the first 10 percent correction for most newbies—has unnerved many.” - V.K. Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services.

The cautious approach among SIP investors is seen as a knee-jerk reaction to recent market conditions, but analysts believe that as the market stabilizes, these investors will likely return to their investment plans.

title: OpenAI whistleblower Suchir Balaji found dead in San Francisco: Authorities - The Hindu
summary:
OpenAI whistleblower Suchir Balaji found dead in San Francisco: Authorities

Publication date: December 14, 2024 Source: The Hindu

A 26-year-old Indian-origin former employee of OpenAI, Suchir Balaji, has tragically died by suicide in San Francisco, raising concerns about the impact of whistleblowing in the tech industry.

  • Suchir Balaji was found dead in his apartment on Buchanan Street on November 26.
  • He publicly accused OpenAI of violating US copyright law three months prior to his death.
  • OpenAI is facing multiple lawsuits claiming it illegally used copyrighted material to train its AI products.
  • Balaji expressed concerns over the ethical implications of technologies developed by OpenAI.
  • His family has requested privacy while they grieve his loss.
“If you believe what I believe, you have to just leave the company. This is not a sustainable model for the internet ecosystem as a whole.” – Suchir Balaji

This tragic incident shines a light on the pressures faced by whistleblowers in the tech sector, as well as the ongoing legal challenges surrounding artificial intelligence and copyright issues. Those in distress are encouraged to seek support and counseling.

title: Stock Market Weekly Recap: SENSEX, NIFTY rebound to extend gains for 4th week; NIFTY IT hits lifetime high - Upstox
summary:
Stock Market Weekly Recap: SENSEX, NIFTY rebound to extend gains for 4th week; NIFTY IT hits lifetime high

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: [Insert Source Here]

It was a roller coaster ride for Indian stock markets this week, but benchmark indices closed higher, extending gains for the fourth consecutive week, driven by strong performances from key sectors.

  • Bharti Airtel, Bajaj Finance, Infosys, and Wipro were major gainers, while Tata Consumer Products, HUL, NTPC, and Reliance Industries saw losses.
  • The NIFTY IT index reached a lifetime high of 46,088.90, increasing over 2.5% for the week.
  • Religare Enterprises shares rose by 10% following RBI approval for the Burman family to acquire an additional stake.
“SENSEX advanced 623.07 points, or 0.76%, while NIFTY gained 90.5 points, or 0.36%, on a weekly basis.”

Despite volatility and cautious investor sentiment linked to global political instability and upcoming US Federal Reserve decisions, the markets showed resilience, with domestic investors buying on dips. This week witnessed significant fluctuations in trading, ending on a positive note with a surge in buying activity.

summary:
MobiKwik IPO Allotment: GMP At 59.14%, A Step-By-Step Guide To Check Allotment Status Online

Publication Date: December 14, 2024

Source: News18

The allotment for the MobiKwik IPO is set to be finalized on December 16, with shares expected to be listed on both BSE and NSE on December 18.

  • The MobiKwik IPO experienced a subscription rate of 125.69 times, with the retail category subscribed 141.78 times.
  • The latest grey market premium (GMP) stands at 59.14%, indicating a strong market expectation for the listing.
  • The IPO's price band was set at Rs 265 to Rs 279 per share.
  • Investors can check their allotment status through BSE, NSE, or Link Intime's portal.
  • The public issue is a fresh issuance of equity shares worth up to Rs 572 crore.
"The 59.14 per cent GMP is higher than the 55.9 per cent grey market premium recorded on the first day of the IPO."

The upcoming listing of MobiKwik's shares is generating significant interest, given the robust subscription rates and favorable GMP signals. Investors are encouraged to stay updated regarding their allotment status.

title: 10:1 Stock Split: 1st-ever sub-division by this multibagger stock; shares rally 8500% in 3 years - ET Now
summary:
10:1 Stock Split: 1st-ever sub-division by this multibagger stock; shares rally 8500% in 3 years

Publication Date: Updated Dec 14, 2024 10:17 IST

Source: ET NOW News

Arunjyoti Bio Ventures Ltd. has announced a 10:1 stock split, marking its first-ever subdivision of shares. This action aims to enhance share affordability and market liquidity as the company continues its robust growth.

  • Arunjyoti Bio Ventures will split each equity share from Rs 10 into ten shares of Re 1 each.
  • This stock split is intended to make shares more accessible for small investors.
  • The company has recorded a remarkable 8500% increase in share price over the past three years.
  • Shares closed at Rs 159, down 3.55% from the previous day.
  • Market capitalization stands at Rs 296.35 crore.
  • The record date for the stock split will be announced after shareholder approval.
“The record date is the cutoff set by a company to decide which shareholders are eligible for corporate actions like dividends, stock splits or bonus shares.”

In conclusion, Arunjyoti Bio Ventures' announcement of a stock split is a strategic move to enhance liquidity and accessibility for investors, reflecting the company's impressive growth trajectory in recent years.

Gold Prices Fall Today In India: Check 22 Carat Rate In Your City On December 14 - News18
summary:
Gold Prices Fall Today In India: Check 22 Carat Rate In Your City On December 14

Publication Date: December 14, 2024, 15:12 IST

Source: News18

Gold prices in India eased marginally on December 14, 2024, aligning with global trends. The cost of 24-carat gold was Rs 79,010 per 10 grams, while 22-carat gold was priced at Rs 72,440 per 10 grams.

  • 24-carat gold is priced at Rs 79,010 per 10 grams.
  • 22-carat gold is priced at Rs 72,440 per 10 grams.
  • Silver is trading at Rs 93,400 per kilogram.
  • City-specific gold rates include:
    • Delhi: 22 carat - Rs 72,440, 24 carat - Rs 79,010
    • Mumbai: 22 carat - Rs 72,290, 24 carat - Rs 78,860
    • Bengaluru: 22 carat - Rs 72,290, 24 carat - Rs 78,860
    • Jaipur: 22 carat - Rs 72,440, 24 carat - Rs 79,010
  • International gold price is down to $2,648.5 an ounce.
“Gold is in the spotlight with a 20.8 per cent return in 2024 with a record high of Rs 79,700. In 2025, it may gain a further 15-18 per cent," said Pranay Aggarwal, CEO of Stoxkart.

The gold market experienced a minor decline, with ongoing fluctuations set to continue influencing investment decisions in the coming weeks.

title: Tata Motors Split, Share Price: Can Tata stock bounce back to Rs 1000 again? Check target and demerger ratio - ET Now
summary:
```html

Tata Motors Split, Share Price: Can Tata stock bounce back to Rs 1000 again? Check target and demerger ratio

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2024

Source: ET NOW

Tata Motors, a favorite among retail investors, has disappointed in 2024 with a steep correction. Investors are curious about the future of Tata Motors shares and if they can bounce back to Rs 1000 in 2025.

  • Tata Motors shares have remained flat on a YTD basis and delivered a 9% return in the last year.
  • Current market price is Rs 790.60, a 33% discount from the 52-week high of Rs 1,179.05.
  • Analysts suggest a cautious approach with an RSI of 51 on the monthly, 35 on the weekly, and 40 on the daily time frame.
  • Recommended buying range is between Rs 680 and Rs 740 for a target price between Rs 800 and Rs 1170.
  • Tata Motors plans to demerge into two companies: commercial vehicles and passenger vehicles, with a 1:1 demerger ratio.
"Judging the price momentum, I recommend market participants avoid aggressive buying at this level. Those interested may consider the buying range between Rs 680 and Rs 740 for a target price between Rs 800 and Rs 1170," the analyst said.

Tata Motors is expected to complete the demerger in the first quarter of the next financial year. Investors should consult their financial advisors before making any investment decisions.

```
